intro: Myosotis aprica, commonly known as the early forget-me-not, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its delicate blue or violet flowers. The plant typically grows in moist meadows and woodland areas, preferring partial to full shade. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while the flowers bloom in early spring. Myosotis aprica is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is also used in traditional herbal medicine.
